alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Taylor; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 9:36PM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .Precipitation will continue to expand across the area for the rest of the night. Expect the light snow falling across parts of southeast Minnesota into western Wisconsin to become a wintry mix as freezing rain mixes in with the snow. There could also be some sleet at times. Expect just the wintry mix for the overnight across northern Iowa. Ice and snow accumulations will occur, with the bulk of the expected ice accumulations overnight into Tuesday morning. Warmer will move in Tuesday changing the wintry mix over to rain for most of the area. Be prepared for slippery roads and a slower than normal commute Tuesday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of one tenth to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa, southeast Minnesota and central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
